gmd:hierarchyLevelName.gco:CharacterString: Highest level of data collection, from a common set of sensors or instrumentation, usually within the same research project

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for Imagery and Gridded Data

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10-11 - Particulate Fe Isotopes from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Particulate Fe isotopes (d56Fe, labile d56Fe, labile[Fe], [Cd], [Ba], and [P]) from GT10 and GT11 cruises. Dataset Description: <p>Particulate iron (Fe) isotope data, including suspended particulate total &delta;56Fe, labile &delta;56Fe, labile [Fe], [Cd], [Ba], and [P], from the 2010 and 2011 U.S. GEOTRACES North Atlantic Transect cruises (GT10 and GT11).</p> Acquisition Description: <p>A subsample of a total digestion of the suspended particles was provided by P. Lam for the analysis of total particle &delta;56Fe. Samples were purified by anion exchange chromatography and analyzed by multi-collector ICPMS.</p><p>The &quot;labile&quot; phase of the suspended particles was determined by leaching with a pH 8 solution containing 0.1 M oxalic acid and 0.05 M EDTA for 2 hours at 90&deg;C. Labile &delta;56Fe was determined according to the same procedures as total &delta;56Fe. Concentrations of Fe, Cd, Ba, and P in the labile phase were determined by analysis of the leachate on an Element single-collector ICP-MS.</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1131387 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=1131387
Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0929491 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=0929491

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Some GeoFish stations are denoted as X_to_Y indicating the tow occurred between stations X and Y. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37242.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees (-90 to 90) Description: Latitude of the sampling station; north is positive. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37243.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees (-180 to 180) Description: Longitude of the sampling station; east is positive. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37244.rdf Name: lon_360 Units: decimal degrees (0 to 360) Description: Longitude of the sampling station from 0 to 360 degrees. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37245.rdf Name: depth Units: meters Description: Sample depth, in meters. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37246.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: Name chosen by project investigators for the research expedition as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Some GeoFish stations are denoted as X_to_Y indicating the tow occurred between stations X and Y. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Latitude of the sampling station; north is positive.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude of the sampling station; east is positive.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude of the sampling station from 0 to 360 degrees.; General Description: longitude ranging from 0 to 360 degrees; especially useful for data collected during sampling transects that cross the dateline

PI-supplied Description: Sample depth, in meters.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Sample_num', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: Fe stable isotope ratio = ((54Fe/56Fe)sample/(54Fe/56Fe)IRMM-014-1)*1000 for the total suspended particles.; General Description: ratio of Fe-54 to Fe-56
PI-supplied Description: 2 sigma uncertainty of tot_d56Fe_susp.; General Description: Iron error; file dependent; refer to data documentation for units and definition

PI-supplied Description: Data quality flag for tot_d56Fe_susp.1 = good data;0 = no data.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation
PI-supplied Description: Fe stable isotope ratio = ((54Fe/56Fe)sample/(54Fe/56Fe)IRMM-014-1)*1000 for the labile phase of suspended particles.; General Description: ratio of Fe-54 to Fe-56
PI-supplied Description: 2 sigma uncertainty of labile_d56Fe_susp.; General Description: Iron error; file dependent; refer to data documentation for units and definition

PI-supplied Description: Data quality flag for tot_d56Fe_susp.1 = good data;0 = no data.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation
PI-supplied Description: Fe concentration.; General Description: Fe (Iron) concentration. May be reported in parts per million, nanomoles/Liter, or other units. Refer to dataset metadata for units.

gml:UnitDefinition.gml:name: nanomoles per Liter (nmol L-1 or nM)

PI-supplied Description: Cd concentration.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Ba concentration.; General Description: Ba (Barium). May be reported in parts per million, nanomoles per Liter, or other units. Refer to dataset metadata for units.

gml:UnitDefinition.gml:name: nanomoles per Liter (nmol L-1 or nM)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: 1 sigma uncertainty of labile_Ba_susp.; General Description: Generic standard error taking on the dimensions of the parameter it is tied to.

gml:UnitDefinition.gml:name: nanomoles per Liter (nmol L-1 or nM)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Data quality flag for labile_Ba_susp.1 = good data;0 = no data.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation
PI-supplied Description: P concentration.; General Description: P (Phosphorus). May be reported in parts per million, nanomoles per liter, or other units. Refer to dataset metadata for units.

gml:UnitDefinition.gml:name: nanomoles per Liter (nmol L-1 or nM)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: 1 sigma uncertainty of labile_P_susp.; General Description: Generic standard error taking on the dimensions of the parameter it is tied to.

gml:UnitDefinition.gml:name: nanomoles per Liter (nmol L-1 or nM)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Data quality flag for labile_Ba_susp.1 = good data;0 = no data.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: Niskin sample bottle number

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g. NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>A subsample of a total digestion of the suspended particles was provided by P. Lam for the analysis of total particle &delta;56Fe. Samples were purified by anion exchange chromatography and analyzed by multi-collector ICPMS.</p><p>The &quot;labile&quot; phase of the suspended particles was determined by leaching with a pH 8 solution containing 0.1 M oxalic acid and 0.05 M EDTA for 2 hours at 90&deg;C. Labile &delta;56Fe was determined according to the same procedures as total &delta;56Fe. Concentrations of Fe, Cd, Ba, and P in the labile phase were determined by analysis of the leachate on an Element single-collector ICP-MS.</p>

<p><b>Data Quality Flags:</b><br />1 = good data;<br />0 = no data.</p><p><b>BCO-DMO Processing Notes:</b><br />Separated original &quot;Station&quot; column into cruise_id, cruise_name, and station_GEOTRC; added lon column from the original lon_360 column; replaced missing data with &quot;nd&quot; to indicate &quot;no data&quot;; modified parameter names to conform with BCO-DMO naming conventions.</p><p><b>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</b><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called &quot;join&quot;) was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters. <br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:Samples were analyzed by multi-collector ICP-MS or on an Element single-collector ICP-MS (see Acquisition Description). Instrument Name: Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:ICP Mass Spec Instrument Description: An ICP Mass Spec is an instrument that passes nebulized samples into an inductively-coupled gas plasma (8-10000 K) where they are atomized and ionized. Ions of specific mass-to-charge ratios are quantified in a quadrupole mass spectrometer. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB15/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
